course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Experiential Epidemiology
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: We will apply epidemiological concepts to examine real world data for current health issues. Hands-on analysis will help you build skills in data management, manipulation, analysis, and writing code in R and/or SAS. This class is recommended for those with an interest in Epidemiology, including the Epi 4+1 program. Prerequisites: QTM 100 AND HLTH 207
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
schedule_location: MW 1pm-2:15pm in Math & Science Center - E301A
sections: Class Nbr: 6075, Section #: 7, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: R. Hood, Status: Open
